titleStmt.title: The declaration and resolution of the citizens of London concerning the Kings Majesty, and the army; and their message, proposals, and desires, to the Lord Generall Fairfax, concerning their dread Soveraign the King, the Prince of Wales, and the Duke of York. With a declaration of the Lord Major, aldermen, and Common-councell of the said city, on Saturday last at Guild-Hall, touching the Lord Generall, and his forces. Also, the further demands of the army, and their summons and proposals to the House of Commons.

The declaration and resolution of the citizens of London concerning the Kings Majesty, and the army; and their message, proposals, and desires, to the Lord Generall Fairfax, concerning their dread Soveraign the King, the Prince of Wales, and the Duke of York. With a declaration of the Lord Major, aldermen, and Common-councell of the said city, on Saturday last at Guild-Hall, touching the Lord Generall, and his forces. Also, the further demands of the army, and their summons and proposals to the House of Commons.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
